article.title: Overview of Project 8 and Progress Towards Tritium Operation

multiple_choice_question.text:
The formula  
  
  
*f<sub>c</sub> = (1 / 2Ï€) * (eB / (m + E<sub>kin</sub>/c<sup>2</sup>))*  
  
  
describes the frequency of cyclotron radiation emitted by a relativistic electron in a magnetic field. What does each variable in this formula represent?
choices: (A) f<sub>c</sub>: cyclotron frequency, e: electron charge, B: magnetic field strength, m: electron rest mass, E<sub>kin</sub>: electron kinetic energy, c: speed of light
(B) f<sub>c</sub>: electron frequency, e: elementary charge, B: magnetic flux density, m: electron mass, E<sub>kin</sub>: electron potential energy, c: speed of sound
(C) f<sub>c</sub>: cyclotron frequency, e: electron energy, B: magnetic field strength, m: electron momentum, E<sub>kin</sub>: electron kinetic energy, c: speed of light
(D) f<sub>c</sub>: electron frequency, e: electron charge, B: magnetic flux density, m: electron rest mass, E<sub>kin</sub>: electron total energy, c: speed of light

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 1 shows the spectrogram of the first electron recorded in Project 8 Phase I. What does the slow decrease in frequency over time represent?
choices: (A) The electron scattering off residual gas molecules, causing discrete energy losses.
(B) The electron losing energy due to collisions with the walls of the trap.
(C) The electron losing energy due to the continuous emission of cyclotron radiation.
(D) The electron\'s velocity decreasing due to the magnetic field.

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 2 shows the energy spectrum near the 30.4 keV L-shell doublet in an optimized trap geometry. What is the significance of the observed resolution of 3.3 eV FWHM?
choices: (A) It represents the energy spread of the electron beam used in the experiment.
(B) It demonstrates the effectiveness of the noise reduction techniques employed.
(C) It indicates that the CRES technique is approaching the natural linewidths of the doublet lines.
(D) It shows the energy resolution limit imposed by the magnetic field homogeneity.

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 4 illustrates the tritium gas system pressure regulation during a commissioning test. What is the purpose of the getter in this system?
choices: (A) To ionize the tritium gas for better trapping.
(B) To maintain a stable and tunable tritium gas pressure.
(C) To remove impurities from the tritium gas.
(D) To measure the pressure of the tritium gas.
